meanings.definition: To scratch or scrape at something with the hands or claws.
meanings.sent1: The cat was scrabbling at the door to be let in.
meanings.sent2: She was scrabbling through the sand to find her lost earring.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was scrabbling at the puzzle pieces, trying to fit them together.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the tree were scrabbling through the soil in search of water.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the squirrel scrabbling up the tree echoed through the forest.

meanings.definition: To struggle or scramble to get something.
meanings.sent1: He was scrabbling to reach the top shelf for the cookie jar.
meanings.sent2: The kids were scrabbling for the last piece of cake at the party.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon was scrabbling to open the tightly sealed trash can.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was scrabbling up a steep mountain of work.
meanings.sent5: The ants were scrabbling to carry the heavy food back to their nest.

meanings.sent1: The branches were scrabbling against the window in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The old record player made a scrabbling sound as it played the vinyl.
meanings.sent3: The mouse was scrabbling around in the walls, causing a disturbance.
meanings.sent4: The dry leaves scrabbling along the pavement in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the chalk scrabbling on the blackboard made everyone cringe.
